oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Waste materials from biogas production - effects on soil fertility and climate
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Johansen , Anders
Carter, Mette S.
Hauggaard-Nielsen, Henrik
Løes, Anne-Kristin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil biology
Nutrient turnover
Health and welfare
Farm nutrient management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Future agricultureal systems will produce bioenergy on basis of on- and off-farm crops and residues, implying beneficial recycling of plant nutrients back to soil and plants. This will reduce emission of climate gases and may also reduce spread of weed seeds, parasites and pathogens. However, it may also induce long-term reduction in soil organic pools.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Johansen , Anders; Carter, Mette S.; Hauggaard-Nielsen, Henrik and Løes, Anne-Kristin (2011) Waste materials from biogas production - effects on soil fertility and climate. Speech at: Program Hushållningssällskapens kompetensdagar och HIR-konferens, Jönköping , 26-27 September 2011.
